Questions.question: Why do you want to work at LawnStarter?
Questions.answer: I'm drawn to LawnStarter's mission of simplifying lawn care. Your technology-driven approach to a traditional service is impressive, and I believe my experience building scalable applications and optimizing performance, as demonstrated with the Dolores project, would be a valuable asset to your team.

Questions.question: Describe your experience with Python and React.
Questions.answer: My experience includes developing backend systems using Python and various frameworks, and building advanced UI features with React. Specifically, I have experience using Python for backend development and ETLing large datasets, as I did in the Dolores project. In addition, I enhanced user experiences with Angular at Sony Pictures Entertainment.

Questions.question: Tell us about a time you automated a workflow successfully.
Questions.answer: As Environmental Manager at Sony Pictures Entertainment, I was responsible for ensuring the stability of all non-production environments. I created automated scripts and processes that allowed developers and QA testers to utilize these environments seamlessly, significantly reducing downtime and improving efficiency.

CoverLetter:
Dear LawnStarter Hiring Team,

I'm writing to express my strong interest in the Software Engineer position at LawnStarter. I've been following LawnStarter's growth for some time now, and I'm genuinely impressed by your mission to simplify lawn care and the innovative approach you've taken to disrupt a traditional industry. The opportunity to contribute to a platform that connects homeowners with local professionals, powered by technology, is incredibly exciting to me. Your tech stack (Python, React, cloud systems) aligns perfectly with my skills and experience.

In my previous role as a Tech Lead Engineer at Sony Pictures Entertainment, I gained valuable experience in designing and architecting complex applications, leading sprint planning, and overseeing production issues. For instance, I led the modernization of a legacy Angular.js and Java Spring Boot application, improving performance, upgrading frameworks, and remediating critical security vulnerabilities. This project not only enhanced the user experience but also significantly improved system security and maintainability. I have a knack for solving complex problems and coming up with innovative solutions.

Prior to that, as a Software Engineer at Sony, I developed core business logic for backend billing and finance systems using Java Spring Boot and enhanced UI features with Angular. I also served as an Environmental Manager, ensuring the stability of non-production environments, which directly facilitated seamless utilization by developers and QA testers. My ability to maintain system reliability under pressure and collaborate effectively within an Agile environment are skills that I believe would greatly benefit your team.

Beyond my professional experience, I've also built several full-stack projects that showcase my skills in modern technologies. The Dolores project, for example, involved optimizing a backend to handle high user traffic, where I ETL'd over 10 million records with PostgreSQL, implemented Redis data caching, and deployed the application on AWS EC2, achieving an impressive 60ms response time for 10,000 clients per second with a 0% error rate during stress testing using loader.io. I'm confident that my experience with Python, React, Node.js, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, AWS, Docker, testing frameworks (Jest, React Testing Library), and other technologies makes me a strong candidate for this role. In my personal time I enjoy keeping up with the latest technology to better hone my skills.

Thank you for considering my application. I am eager to learn more about this opportunity and discuss how my skills and experience can contribute to LawnStarter's continued success.

Sincerely,

Yasin Khan

Questions.question: Why are you interested in GreenTech?
Questions.answer: GreenTech's commitment to sustainable solutions resonates with me, and I'm eager to contribute my backend expertise to a company making a positive impact. I'm particularly drawn to the opportunity to build scalable systems that support your mission.

Questions.question: Explain your experience with cloud platforms.
Questions.answer: I have experience deploying and managing applications on AWS, as demonstrated by my Dolores project using EC2, NGINX, and Redis. I also have familiarity with Firebase and Heroku, and I'm comfortable working with cloud-based databases like PostgreSQL and MongoDB.

Questions.question: Describe a backend project you are proud of.
Questions.answer: I'm particularly proud of the Dolores project where I optimized the backend to handle high traffic. By ETL'ing millions of records into PostgreSQL, implementing Redis caching, and deploying on AWS with load balancing, I achieved a 60ms response time with zero errors under heavy load.

CoverLetter:
Dear GreenTech Hiring Team,

I am writing to express my keen interest in the Backend Developer position at GreenTech. I have been consistently impressed by GreenTech's commitment to sustainable technology and your innovative approach to [mention a specific project or aspect of GreenTech that resonates with you]. The opportunity to contribute to a company that aligns with my values while leveraging my backend development expertise is truly exciting.

In my previous role as a Tech Lead Engineer at Sony Pictures Entertainment, I architected and modernized business applications, ensuring their security, reliability, and alignment with business priorities. I spearheaded the redesign of a legacy Angular.js and Java Spring Boot codebase, upgrading frameworks and remediating critical security vulnerabilities. Beyond architecture and project leadership, I was also hands-on, developing core business logic for backend billing and finance systems, and enhancing user experiences with advanced UI features.

One project that directly relates to the requirements outlined in the job description is my work on "Dolores," where I optimized an existing frontend's backend to handle significant user traffic. I ETL'd over 10 million records using PostgreSQL, shaping the data entirely on the database side. To further enhance performance, I implemented Redis data caching for network requests. I also deployed the application on an AWS EC2 micro instance, horizontally scaling and load balancing it with NGINX. The result was a system that withstood stress tests of 10,000 clients per second with a 0% error rate, averaging response times of only 60ms. This experience demonstrates my ability to design, optimize, and deploy robust and scalable systems within a cloud infrastructure.

My skillset includes proficiency in Python, Node.js, React, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, and AWS. I have practical experience with containerization using Docker, and I'm well-versed in utilizing testing frameworks like Jest and React Testing Library to ensure code quality and reliability. My project, Animedia, used GraphQL for API interactions, Prisma for database schema design, and NextAuth for user authentication.

I am confident that my experience in designing and optimizing backend systems, coupled with my passion for GreenTech's mission, makes me a strong candidate for this position. I am eager to learn more about this opportunity and discuss how my skills and experience can contribute to your team's success.

Thank you for your time and consideration. I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Sincerely,
Yasin Khan
